title: Zelenskiy confirms for first time that Ukrainian troops active in Russia's Belgorod region
JD Vance Uses 1 Derogatory Word To Describe China, And People Are Disgusted
Trump threatens new 50% tariffs on China
description: The US president says he will introduce the additional tax unless Beijing withdraws its own 34% counter-tariff on American goods.

title: Wild market swings as tariffs rattle US economy
description: Stocks swung sharply in the US, as Trump offered mixed signals about appetite for trade talks.

title: Apple's 3-day loss in market cap swells to almost $640 billion
description: Apple is reeling over concerns that President Donald Trump's tariffs could force the iPhone maker to raise prices or accept lower profits.

title: CEOs think the U.S. is 'probably in a recession right now,' says BlackRock's Larry Fink
description: The asset management executive also said that the he thinks the tariffs of President Donald Trump could put upward pressure on inflation.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Uncertainty Over Tariffs Leads to Wild Swings in Markets
description: The S&P 500 slipped into bear market territory in early trading but by the end of the day climbed back close to where it opened. President Trump said he would not back off his trade war, reinforcing fears of a global economic downturn.
author: The New York Times

title: In Response to Trump, E.U. Prepares to Vote on Retaliatory Tariffs
description: European Union officials will vet and vote on a list of retaliatory tariffs this week, while contemplating what comes next.
author: Jeanna Smialek

title: Supreme Court temporarily backs Trump in controversial deportations case - NPR
description: Supreme Court temporarily backs Trump in controversial deportations case  NPRSupreme Court Overturns Block on Trump Administration’s Venezuelan Deportations  The New York TimesSupreme Court allows Trump to enforce Alien Enemies Act for rapid deportations for now  CNNSupreme Court requires noncitizens to challenge detention and removal in Texas  SCOTUSblogSupreme Court splits 5-4 to grant Trump emergency relief in deportation litgation  MSNBC News

title: Trump tariffs live updates: Trump says he's not looking at 90-day pause - ABC News
description: Trump tariffs live updates: Trump says he's not looking at 90-day pause  ABC NewsTrump says he’s ready to talk as new stock market losses fuel tariff chaos  CNNAsian stocks see their worst drop in decades after Trump tariffs  BBCLive updates: Trump, Netanyahu meet at White House amid turmoil over tariffs  The Washington PostHow tariffs work and why they are a key part of Trump's agenda  NBC News

title: Iran Says Will Hold "Indirect High-Level" Talks With US In Oman Saturday
description: Iran and the United States will hold "indirect high-level" talks in Oman on Saturday, Iran's foreign minister said Tuesday, hours after US President Donald Trump announced talks with Tehran.

title: China Says Won't Bow To Fresh Trump Tariff Threat
description: China said Monday it would not cave to pressure or threats after US President Donald Trump vowed additional 50 percent tariffs on its goods if Beijing did not retract planned countermeasures.

title: Defence secretary meets family of Kenyan woman allegedly killed by British soldiers
description: Relatives of Agnes Wanjiru say 13-year fight for justice has taken ‘heavy toll’ after meeting with John HealeyThe family of a Kenyan woman who was allegedly killed by British soldiers have said their 13-year fight for justice has taken a “heavy toll”, and that they have been offered “too many empty promises” after a meeting with the defence secretary.Agnes Wanjiru was 21 when she disappeared in March 2012. She was last seen in the company of British soldiers in a bar in a hotel in Nanyuki, a town in eastern Kenya where the British army has a military base, BATUK. Continue reading...
author: Hannah Al-Othman North of England correspondent

title: Trump administration revokes all South Sudanese visas in repatriation row
description: State department accuses east African country of ‘taking advantage of the United States’The US is revoking the visas of all South Sudanese passport-holders and will stop any more of its citizens entering the country.The Department of State said South Sudan was “taking advantage of the United States” by failing to comply with US efforts to return people to the east African country, adding that the measures would come into effect immediately. Continue reading...
author: Faisal Ali

title: Who is Shoshana Chatfield? US navy officer fired for 'woke' comments
description: Vice Admiral Shoshana Chatfield was dismissed by the Trump administration, allegedly due to her support for diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives within the military. Admiral Christopher Grady informed Chatfield of the decision, reportedly influenced by Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth. This marks the third removal of a high-ranking female officer under Trump.
author: TOI World Desk

title: ‘Will make world trade better for US’: Trump declares full support for ‘one, big, beautiful bill’
description: US president Trump has endorsed the Senate's newly approved budget plan, highlighting its inclusion of permanent tax cuts, significant spending reductions, and enhanced border security measures. The bill, passed along party lines, aims to extend Trump-era tax cuts and allocate substantial funds to military and immigration enforcement. However, Democrats strongly oppose the plan, raising concerns about potential harm to social programs.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Asia markets rebound despite Trump’s threat of new tariffs on China
description: President Donald Trump has threatened to impose an additional 50 percent tariff on all Chinese products if Beijing does not rescind its retaliatory duties.
author: Michael E. Miller

title: Trump says U.S. will have ‘direct’ talks with Iran over nuclear program
description: Iran insisted that any negotiations, due to take place in Oman, would be “indirect,” conducted through mediators.
author: Michael Birnbaum, Karen DeYoung
